benchmark_details.name: ALFRED-ChaOS and VirtualHome-ChaOS
benchmark_details.overview: The paper introduces LERa, a Visual Language Model-based replanning approach, and presents two new evaluation datasets, ALFRED-ChaOS and VirtualHome-ChaOS, to assess the ability of the approach to replan in dynamic environments.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a replanning methodology for robots using visual feedback and to evaluate its effectiveness through newly introduced datasets.

data.source: The datasets are created based on existing environments corresponding to tasks in ALFRED and VirtualHome.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the completion of tasks and comparisons against predefined success criteria.
methodology.interpretation: Higher metrics indicate better performance of the replanning approach in dynamic environments.
methodology.baseline_results: LERa improved success rates significantly, achieving over 40% improvement over baselines.
methodology.validation: Experiments including real-world trials with a tabletop manipulator robot confirmed the effectiveness of LERa.
